contentList.content: You have achieved a state of undeath. Be it your choice or not, you walk again.

Your undead nature means you are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to Poison damage, and <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Necrotic damage. However, as a consequence, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Radiant damage.
Undead can come from many different walks of life. Choose the origins that most apply to your character.
Once per long rest, you can survive a killing blow with 1 hitpoint, unless the damage is Radiant or from a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
Should you recieve a non-<LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">critical</LSTag> killing blow, you will survive with 1 hit point, unless the damage is Radiant.
You once came from Baldur's Gate.
You once came from the Underdark.
You hail from the Astral Plane.
You were a Human in life.
You were a High Elf in life.
You were a Wood Elf in life.
You were a Lolth-sworn Drow in life.
You were a Seldarine Drow in life.
You were a High Half-Elf in life.
You were a High Half-Elf in life.
You were a Drow Half-Elf in life.
You were an Asmodeus Tiefling in life.
You were a Mephistopheles Tiefling in life.
You were a Zariel Tiefling in life.
You were a Githyanki in life.
Whoever you were in life is long gone.
Wherever you once came from you cannot recall.
Undead can come from many different walks of life. Choose the origins that most apply to your character.
Your newly acquired Tadpole creates an illusion, hiding your undead form from others who view you. You may choose to reveal this disguise so that you, too, can see it.
Reveal the disguise that your Tadpole has created for you.
Poison statuses not only have no effect on you, but they also heal you for [1]. Once you have been exposed to a Poison status you become immune to it for 1 turn.
Affected entity has recently healed from exposure to poison, rendering them immune for 5 turns.

You are a newly formed Lich. Your cause may have been noble, or perhaps purely sinister. Regardless, your journey to lichdom has taken its toll, but soon your power will be insurmountable— so long as you keep your phylactery safe and close.

The powerful magic granted to you by your lichdom allows you to effortlessly float instead of walking. Your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> can't be reduced by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.
Your lichdom is new and the bond to your Phylactery is still forming. If you do not keep it close, you will be left in a weakened state.
Separation from your Phylactery has left you in a weakened state. You are now vulnerable to all damage that your undead nature doesn't already render you resistant to.

Call your Phylactery to your side for safe keeping.

You may only do this once.
Channel the unnatural deathly chill of your body to harm your enemies.

Affected entity is <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Cold damage and <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Fire damage, and their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> is reduced by [1]
Draw on the life force of surrounding entities, both living and undead, and drain it from them, dealing [1] and healing yourself for the damage dealt.
Living targets take no damage, Undead targets take half damage, you are still healed.

You are a Ghoul, a bloodthirsty creature keen to dine on flesh and carrion, and a savage fighter unafraid to use tooth and nail to fell your targets. Did your taste for flesh in life drive you to this foul fate? Or did the bite of another Ghoul turn you against your will?
You can utilize your Necrotic claws and Poisonous bite in battle.
Lash out with your sharp claws to attack your enemies.
Your state of undeath has evolved, and your necrotic claws can now <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyze</LSTag> your enemies.
Ravage your enemies with your vile bite.
Your state of undeath has evolved, your bite can now <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> your enemies.
Your unending thirst for flesh drives you to devour your slain enemies, healing yourself by [1].
Felling your enemy with your claws or bite drives you to consume, granting you the ability to devour their remains.
Your body stinks of death and carrion, emitting an aura that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseates</LSTag> all enemies within 2m.
The affected entity's foul stench emits an aura that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseates</LSTag> all enemies within 2m.

You are a Mummy, an undead guardian tasked with protecting ancient tombs and temples; fighting off grave robbers and those who would desecrate such sacred sites. Perhaps you were given this position as a great honour in death? Or maybe it's a punishment.
You consider your bandages to be part of your body and they cannot be removed. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
You may choose to learn the methods by which to ritualistically remove one of your organs and preserve it, granting a new boon to your undead body.
Removing your stomach will leave you hungerless, allowing you regain full hit points whenever you short rest.
Your stomach has been removed and preserved. Whenever you short rest, you regain your full hit points.
A Canopic Jar containing your preserved stomach.
Remove your stomach and place it into a Canopic Jar for safekeeping. Once removed, you will regain full hit points whenever you short rest.
Removing your lungs will leave you breathless, making you immune to being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Your lungs have been removed and preserved. You cannot be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Remove your lungs and place them into a Canopic Jar for safekeeping. Once removed, you will be immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag>.
A Canopic Jar containing your preserved lungs.
Removing your intestines will purify your body, making you immune to curses and disease.
Your intestines have been removed and preserved. You are immune to curses and disease.
Remove your intestines and place them into a Canopic Jar for safekeeping. Once removed, you will be immune to curses and disease.
A Canopic Jar containing your preserved intestines.

Removing your liver will soothe your emotions, making you immune to being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>. As a consequence you also cannot get drunk.

Your liver has been removed and preserved. You are immune to being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, you also cannot get drunk.

Remove your liver and place it into a Canopic Jar for safekeeping. Once removed you will be immune to being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, you also cannot get drunk.
A Canopic Jar containing your preserved liver.
Curse your target and inflict them with Mummy Rot. They cannot heal and will take [1] at the start of each turn.
Target has been afflicted with Mummy Rot. They cannot heal and will take [1] at the start of each turn.
If the target dies while afflicted with the initial Mummy Rot curse, you may curse another target once per short rest.

Your very presence fills your enemies with despair, causing them <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> within 3m.
Enemies within 3m suffer <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Entity suffers <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

You are a Wight, a vicious and cruel undead that is full of hatred and takes joy in the destruction of the living. Despite this, you've a strong personality and great discipline; unlike many of your undead brethren. Was it your vile existence that caused this undeath? Or were you the unfortunate victim of another Wight?
You acquire your target and mark them for death. The target may be inflicted with fear and your attacks against the target deal an extra [1].
Felling your marked target will grant you Bloodlust, adding an extra 1d4 to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Entity suffers an additional [1] from the spellcaster.
Attacking the target of your Mark deals an extra [1].
Used to mark targets with Marked for Death.
Mark is still applied however target will not be frightened.

Killing your marked prey will send you into a Bloodlust, adding an extra 1d4 on to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. You can extend this bloodlust by raising a Half-Wight or draining your foe's energy while Bloodlust is active.
You have felled your mark, spurring you on to fight even harder. You add an extra 1d4 on to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Your undeath spreads like a disease. Once per long rest, when you fell a target, you can raise them to fight alongside you.
You have felled a foe. You may now raise them, or another corpse, to fight alongside you.
Your undeath is contagious. Having felled your foe, you may now raise them as undead to fight alongside you.
Raising a Half-Wight while your Bloodlust is active will extend it by 2 turns.
Drain the life force of a living target, damaging them for [1] and gaining 12 temporary hitpoints.
Draining an enemy's energy while your Bloodlust is active will extend it by 2 turns.
Enemies take half damage, you still receive 12 temporary hitpoints

Make nearby foes <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Slashing damage, unless they are already <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to it.
Nearby foes are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Slashing damage, unless they are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to it.

Nearby foes are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Slashing damage, unless they are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to it. You also gain an additional 3m movement speed.
If the aura is activated while you have Bloodlust, you gain an additional 3m Movement.
Effected entity is <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Slashing damage.
A pouch made of magic infused fabric, designed to safely deliver your Phylactery to your side.
A pouch made of magic infused fabric, designed to safely deliver your Canopic Jar to your side.
Necrotic power gained from your Lichdom. Used to cast spells that are granted by your Phylactery.

A fine but unnaturally sturdy glass bottle that is trimmed in silver, it emits a deathly cold. As your power grows, it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold damage, and spells that harness your chilling power.
A silver-trimmed bottle that is icy to the touch. It thrums with the energy of your soul.

With your Phylactery close, your body is strong. The vulnerability of your new lichdom doesn't effect you, and as your power grows it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold damage, and spells that harness your chilling power.

A solid flask crafted from obsidian and adorned with gems, it's hot to the touch. As your power grows, it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire damage, and spells that harness your scorching power.
A hefty flask that radiates heat. It thrums with the energy of your soul.

With your Phylactery close, your body is strong. The vulnerability of your new lichdom doesn't effect you, and as your power grows it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire damage, and spells that harness your scorching power.

A deep purple bottle with an ornate collar, you can hear it faintly rumble. As your power grows, it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Thunder damage, and spells that harness your thunderous power.
A deep purple bottle that vibrates slightly in your hands. It thrums with the energy of your soul.

With your Phylactery close, your body is strong. The vulnerability of your new lichdom doesn't effect you, and as your power grows it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Thunder damage, and spells that harness your thunderous power.

A clear crystal bottle decorated with gold, holding it sends pins and needles through your hands. As your power grows, it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Lightning damage, and spells that harness your shocking power.
A clear crystal bottle that radiates static energy. It thrums with the energy of your soul.

With your Phylactery close, your body is strong. The vulnerability of your new lichdom doesn't effect you, and as your power grows it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Lightning damage, and spells that harness your shocking power.

A dark wooden box trimmed with silver, necrotic energy seeps from under its lid. As your power grows, it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Necrotic damage, and spells that harness your necrotic power.
A dark wooden box that saps the energy around it. It thrums with the energy of your soul.

With your Phylactery close, your body is strong. The vulnerability of your new lichdom doesn't effect you, and as your power grows it may grant you <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Necrotic damage, and spells that harness your necrotic power.
Call forth a monolith of cursed fire to incinerate your enemies like the wrath of the hells itself.
Call forth a terrifying storm in a 6 meter radius. Creatures within the storm are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> and take damage at the start of their turn.

Creatures starting their turn in the area take [1]. Creatures ending their turn in the area are possibly take [2] and are knocked Prone.

The area is Difficult Terrain.

A roaring storm batters you with its sheer force.

Creatures starting their turn in the area take [1]. Creatures ending their turn in the area possibly take [2] and are knocked Prone.

The area is Difficult Terrain, and creatures within are Blinded.

Takes [1] at the start of their turn, and possibly [2] and knocked Prone at the end of their turn, as long as they are in the area.

They are Blinded, and the area is Difficult Terrain.
Ancient and delicate linen wrappings designed to cover a Mummy's body.
Disguise yourself as an Lich with a masculine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Lich with a feminine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Ghoul with a masculine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Ghoul with a feminine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Wight with a masculine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Wight with a feminine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Mummy with a masculine body type.
Disguise yourself as an Mummy with a feminine body type.
